DATE.d: Returns the number that represents the date in the date-time code

DATEDIF.d: Returns the difference between two date values (start date and end date), based on the interval (unit) specified

DATEVALUE.d: Converts a date in the form of text to a number that represents the date in the date-time code

DAY.d: Returns the day of the month, a number from 1 to 31.

DAYS.d: Returns the number of days between the two dates.

DAYS360.d: Returns the number of days between two dates based on a 360-day year (twelve 30-day months)

EDATE.d: Returns the serial number of the date that is the indicated number of months before or after the start date

EOMONTH.d: Returns the serial number of the last day of the month before or after a specified number of months

HOUR.d: Returns the hour as a number from 0 (12:00 A.M.) to 23 (11:00 P.M.).

ISOWEEKNUM.d: Returns the ISO week number in the year for a given date

MINUTE.d: Returns the minute, a number from 0 to 59.

MONTH.d: Returns the month, a number from 1 (January) to 12 (December).

NETWORKDAYS.d: Returns the number of whole workdays between two dates

NETWORKDAYS.INTL.d: Returns the number of whole workdays between two dates with custom weekend parameters

NOW.d: Returns the current date and time formatted as a date and time.

SECOND.d: Returns the second, a number from 0 to 59.

TIME.d: Converts hours, minutes and seconds given as numbers to a serial number, formatted with a time format

TIMEVALUE.d: Converts a text time to a serial number for a time, a number from 0 (12:00:00 AM) to 0.999988426 (11:59:59 PM). Format the number with a time format after entering the formula

TODAY.d: Returns the current date formatted as a date.

WEEKDAY.d: Returns a number from 1 to 7 identifying the day of the week of a date.

WEEKNUM.d: Returns the week number in the year

WORKDAY.d: Returns the serial number of the date before or after a specified number of workdays

WORKDAY.INTL.d: Returns the serial number of the date before or after a specified number of workdays with custom weekend parameters

YEAR.d: Returns the year of a date, an integer in the range 1900-9999.

YEARFRAC.d: Returns the year fraction representing the number of whole days between start_date and end_date

BESSELI.d: Returns the modified Bessel function In(x)

BESSELK.d: Returns the modified Bessel function Kn(x)

BIN2DEC.d: Converts a binary number to decimal

BIN2HEX.d: Converts a binary number to hexadecimal

BIN2OCT.d: Converts a binary number to octal

BITAND.d: Returns a bitwise 'And' of two numbers

BITLSHIFT.d: Returns a number shifted left by shift_amount bits

BITOR.d: Returns a bitwise 'Or' of two numbers

BITRSHIFT.d: Returns a number shifted right by shift_amount bits

BITXOR.d: Returns a bitwise 'Exclusive Or' of two numbers

COMPLEX.d: Converts real and imaginary coefficients into a complex number

CONVERT.d: Converts a number from one measurement system to another

DEC2BIN.d: Converts a decimal number to binary

DEC2HEX.d: Converts a decimal number to hexadecimal

DEC2OCT.d: Converts a decimal number to octal

DELTA.d: Tests whether two numbers are equal

GESTEP.d: Tests whether a number is greater than a threshold value

HEX2BIN.d: Converts a Hexadecimal number to binary

HEX2DEC.d: Converts a hexadecimal number to decimal

HEX2OCT.d: Converts a hexadecimal number to octal

IMABS.d: Returns the absolute value (modulus) of a complex number

IMAGINARY.d: Returns the imaginary coefficient of a complex number

IMARGUMENT.d: Returns the argument q, an angle expressed in radians

IMCONJUGATE.d: Returns the complex conjugate of a complex number

IMCOS.d: Returns the cosine of a complex number

IMCOSH.d: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a complex number

IMCOT.d: Returns the cotangent of a complex number

IMCSC.d: Returns the cosecant of a complex number

IMCSCH.d: Returns the hyperbolic cosecant of a complex number

IMDIV.d: Returns the quotient of two complex numbers

IMEXP.d: Returns the exponential of a complex number

IMLN.d: Returns the natural logarithm of a complex number

IMLOG10.d: Returns the base-10 logarithm of a complex number

IMLOG2.d: Returns the base-2 logarithm of a complex number

IMPOWER.d: Returns a complex number raised to an integer power

IMPRODUCT.d: Returns the product of 1 to 255 complex numbers

IMREAL.d: Returns the real coefficient of a complex number

IMSEC.d: Returns the secant of a complex number

IMSECH.d: Returns the hyperbolic secant of a complex number

IMSIN.d: Returns the sine of a complex number

IMSINH.d: Returns the hyperbolic sine of a complex number

IMSQRT.d: Returns the square root of a complex number

IMSUB.d: Returns the difference of two complex numbers

IMSUM.d: Returns the sum of complex numbers

IMTAN.d: Returns the tangent of a complex number

OCT2BIN.d: Converts an octal number to binary

OCT2DEC.d: Converts an octal number to decimal

OCT2HEX.d: Converts an octal number to hexadecimal

DAVERAGE.d: Averages the values in a column in a list or database that match conditions you specify

DCOUNT.d: Counts the cells containing numbers in the field (column) of records in the database that match the conditions you specify

DCOUNTA.d: Counts nonblank cells in the field (column) of records in the database that match the conditions you specify

DGET.d: Extracts from a database a single record that matches the conditions you specify

DMAX.d: Returns the largest number in the field (column) of records in the database that match the conditions you specify

DMIN.d: Returns the smallest number in the field (column) of records in the database that match the conditions you specify

DPRODUCT.d: Multiplies the values in the field (column) of records in the database that match the conditions you specify

DSTDEV.d: Estimates the standard deviation based on a sample from selected database entries

DSTDEVP.d: Calculates the standard deviation based on the entire population of selected database entries

DSUM.d: Adds the numbers in the field (column) of records in the database that match the conditions you specify

DVAR.d: Estimates variance based on a sample from selected database entries

DVARP.d: Calculates variance based on the entire population of selected database entries

CHAR.d: Returns the character specified by the code number from the character set for your computer

CLEAN.d: Removes all nonprintable characters from text

CODE.d: Returns a numeric code for the first character in a text string, in the character set used by your computer

CONCATENATE.d: Joins several text strings into one text string

CONCAT.d: Concatenates a list or range of text strings

DOLLAR.d: Converts a number to text, using currency format

EXACT.d: Checks whether two text strings are exactly the same, and returns TRUE or FALSE. EXACT is case-sensitive

FIND.d: Returns the starting position of one text string within another text string. FIND is case-sensitive

FINDB.d: Finds the specified substring (string-1) within a string (string-2) and is intended for languages the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

FIXED.d: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals and returns the result as text with or without commas

LEFT.d: Returns the specified number of characters from the start of a text string

LEFTB.d: Extracts the substring from the specified string starting from the left character and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

LEN.d: Returns the number of characters in a text string

LENB.d: Analyses the specified string and returns the number of characters it contains and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

LOWER.d: Converts all letters in a text string to lowercase

MID.d: Returns the characters from the middle of a text string, given a starting position and length

MIDB.d: Extracts the characters from the specified string starting from any position and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

NUMBERVALUE.d: Converts text to number in a locale-independent manner

PROPER.d: Converts a text string to proper case; the first letter in each word to uppercase, and all other letters to lowercase

REPLACE.d: Replaces part of a text string with a different text string

REPLACEB.d: Replaces a set of characters, based on the number of characters and the start position you specify, with a new set of characters and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

REPT.d: Repeats text a given number of times. Use REPT to fill a cell with a number of instances of a text string

RIGHT.d: Returns the specified number of characters from the end of a text string

RIGHTB.d: Extracts a substring from a string starting from the right-most character, based on the specified number of characters and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

SEARCH.d: Returns the number of the character at which a specific character or text string is first found, reading left to right (not case-sensitive)

SEARCHB.d: Returns the location of the specified substring in a string and is intended for languages that use the double-byte character set (DBCS) like Japanese, Chinese, Korean etc.

SUBSTITUTE.d: Replaces existing text with new text in a text string

T.d: Checks whether a value is text, and returns the text if it is, or returns double quotes (empty text) if it is not

TEXT.d: Converts a value to text in a specific number format

TEXTJOIN.d: Concatenates a list or range of text strings using a delimiter

TRIM.d: Removes all spaces from a text string except for single spaces between words

UNICHAR.d: Returns the Unicode character referenced by the given numeric value

UNICODE.d: Returns the number (code point) corresponding to the first character of the text

UPPER.d: Converts a text string to all uppercase letters

VALUE.d: Converts a text string that represents a number to a number

AVEDEV.d: Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean. Arguments can be numbers or names, arrays or references that contain numbers

AVERAGE.d: Returns the average (arithmetic mean) of its arguments, which can be numbers or names, arrays or references that contain numbers

AVERAGEA.d: Returns the average (arithmetic mean) of its arguments, evaluating text and FALSE in arguments as 0; TRUE evaluates as 1. Arguments can be numbers, names, arrays or references

AVERAGEIF.d: Finds average (arithmetic mean) for the cells specified by a given condition or criteria

AVERAGEIFS.d: Finds average (arithmetic mean) for the cells specified by a given set of conditions or criteria

BETADIST.d: Returns the cumulative beta probability density function

BETAINV.d: Returns the inverse of the cumulative beta probability density function (BETADIST)

BETA.DIST.d: Returns the beta probability distribution function

BETA.INV.d: Returns the inverse of the cumulative beta probability density function (BETA.DIST)

BINOMDIST.d: Returns the individual term binomial distribution probability

BINOM.DIST.d: Returns the individual term binomial distribution probability

BINOM.DIST.RANGE.d: Returns the probability of a trial result using a binomial distribution

BINOM.INV.d: Returns the smallest value for which the cumulative binomial distribution is greater than or equal to a criterion value

CHIDIST.d: Returns the right-tailed probability of the chi-squared distribution

CHIINV.d: Returns the inverse of the right-tailed probability of the chi-squared distribution

CHITEST.d: Returns the test for independence: the value from the chi-squared distribution for the statistic and the appropriate degrees of freedom

CHISQ.DIST.d: Returns the left-tailed probability of the chi-squared distribution

CHISQ.DIST.RT.d: Returns the right-tailed probability of the chi-squared distribution

CHISQ.INV.d: Returns the inverse of the left-tailed probability of the chi-squared distribution

CHISQ.INV.RT.d: Returns the inverse of the right-tailed probability of the chi-squared distribution

CHISQ.TEST.d: Returns the test for independence: the value from the chi-squared distribution for the statistic and the appropriate degrees of freedom

CONFIDENCE.d: Returns the confidence interval for a population mean, using a normal distribution

CONFIDENCE.NORM.d: Returns the confidence interval for a population mean, using a normal distribution

CONFIDENCE.T.d: Returns the confidence interval for a population mean, using a Student's T distribution

CORREL.d: Returns the correlation coefficient between two data sets

COUNT.d: Counts the number of cells in a range that contain numbers

COUNTA.d: Counts the number of cells in a range that are not empty

COUNTBLANK.d: Counts the number of empty cells in a specified range of cells

COUNTIF.d: Counts the number of cells within a range that meet the given condition

COUNTIFS.d: Counts the number of cells specified by a given set of conditions or criteria

COVAR.d: Returns covariance, the average of the products of deviations for each data point pair in two data sets

COVARIANCE.P.d: Returns population covariance, the average of the products of deviations for each data point pair in two data sets

COVARIANCE.S.d: Returns sample covariance, the average of the products of deviations for each data point pair in two data sets

CRITBINOM.d: Returns the smallest value for which the cumulative binomial distribution is greater than or equal to a criterion value

DEVSQ.d: Returns the sum of squares of deviations of data points from their sample mean

FDIST.d: Returns the (right-tailed) F probability distribution (degree of diversity) for two data sets

FINV.d: Returns the inverse of the (right-tailed) F probability distribution: if p = FDIST(x,...), then FINV(p,...) = x

FTEST.d: Returns the result of an F-test, the two-tailed probability that the variances in Array1 and Array2 are not significantly different

F.DIST.d: Returns the (left-tailed) F probability distribution (degree of diversity) for two data sets

F.DIST.RT.d: Returns the (right-tailed) F probability distribution (degree of diversity) for two data sets

F.INV.d: Returns the inverse of the (left-tailed) F probability distribution: if p = F.DIST(x,...), then F.INV(p,...) = x

F.INV.RT.d: Returns the inverse of the (right-tailed) F probability distribution: if p = F.DIST.RT(x,...), then F.INV.RT(p,...) = x

F.TEST.d: Returns the result of an F-test, the two-tailed probability that the variances in Array1 and Array2 are not significantly different

FISHERINV.d: Returns the inverse of the Fisher transformation: if y = FISHER(x), then FISHERINV(y) = x

FORECAST.d: Calculates, or predicts, a future value along a linear trend by using existing values

FORECAST.ETS.d: Returns the forecasted value for a specific future target date using exponential smoothing method.

FORECAST.ETS.CONFINT.d: Returns a confidence interval for the forecast value at the specified target date.

FORECAST.ETS.SEASONALITY.d: Returns the length of the repetitive pattern an application detects for the specified time series.

FORECAST.ETS.STAT.d: Returns the requested statistic for the forecast.

FORECAST.LINEAR.d: Calculates, or predicts, a future value along a linear trend by using existing values

FREQUENCY.d: Calculates how often values occur within a range of values and then returns a vertical array of numbers that have one more element than Bins_array

GAMMAINV.d: Returns the inverse of the gamma cumulative distribution: if p = GAMMADIST(x,...), then GAMMAINV(p,...) = x

GAMMA.INV.d: Returns the inverse of the gamma cumulative distribution: if p = GAMMA.DIST(x,...), then GAMMA.INV(p,...) = x

GAMMALN.d: Returns the natural logarithm of the gamma function

GAMMALN.PRECISE.d: Returns the natural logarithm of the gamma function

GAUSS.d: Returns 0.5 less than the standard normal cumulative distribution

GEOMEAN.d: Returns the geometric mean of an array or range of positive numeric data

GROWTH.d: Returns numbers in an exponential growth trend matching known data points

HARMEAN.d: Returns the harmonic mean of a data set of positive numbers: the reciprocal of the arithmetic mean of reciprocals

INTERCEPT.d: Calculates the point at which a line will intersect the y-axis by using a best-fit regression line plotted through the known x-values and y-values

KURT.d: Returns the kurtosis of a data set

LARGE.d: Returns the k-th largest value in a data set. For example, the fifth largest number

LINEST.d: Returns statistics that describe a linear trend matching known data points, by fitting a straight line using the least squares method

LOGEST.d: Returns statistics that describe an exponential curve matching known data points

LOGINV.d: Returns the inverse of the lognormal cumulative distribution function of x, where ln(x) is normally distributed with parameters Mean and Standard_dev

LOGNORM.DIST.d: Returns the lognormal distribution of x, where ln(x) is normally distributed with parameters Mean and Standard_dev

LOGNORM.INV.d: Returns the inverse of the lognormal cumulative distribution function of x, where ln(x) is normally distributed with parameters Mean and Standard_dev

LOGNORMDIST.d: Returns the cumulative lognormal distribution of x, where ln(x) is normally distributed with parameters Mean and Standard_dev

MAX.d: Returns the largest value in a set of values. Ignores logical values and text

MAXA.d: Returns the largest value in a set of values. Does not ignore logical values and text

MAXIFS.d: Returns the maximum value among cells specified by a given set of conditions or criteria

MEDIAN.d: Returns the median, or the number in the middle of the set of given numbers

MIN.d: Returns the smallest number in a set of values. Ignores logical values and text

MINA.d: Returns the smallest value in a set of values. Does not ignore logical values and text

MINIFS.d: Returns the minimum value among cells specified by a given set of conditions or criteria

MODE.d: Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in an array or range of data

MODE.MULT.d: Returns a vertical array of the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, values in an array or range of data. For a horizontal array, use =TRANSPOSE(MODE.MULT(number1,number2,...))

MODE.SNGL.d: Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in an array or range of data

NEGBINOM.DIST.d: Returns the negative binomial distribution, the probability that there will be Number_f failures before the Number_s-th success, with Probability_s probability of a success

NEGBINOMDIST.d: Returns the negative binomial distribution, the probability that there will be Number_f failures before the Number_s-th success, with Probability_s probability of a success

NORM.DIST.d: Returns the normal distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation

NORMDIST.d: Returns the normal cumulative distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation

NORM.INV.d: Returns the inverse of the normal cumulative distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation

NORMINV.d: Returns the inverse of the normal cumulative distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation

NORM.S.DIST.d: Returns the standard normal distribution (has a mean of zero and a standard deviation of one)

NORMSDIST.d: Returns the standard normal cumulative distribution (has a mean of zero and a standard deviation of one)

NORM.S.INV.d: Returns the inverse of the standard normal cumulative distribution (has a mean of zero and a standard deviation of one)

NORMSINV.d: Returns the inverse of the standard normal cumulative distribution (has a mean of zero and a standard deviation of one)

PEARSON.d: Returns the Pearson product moment correlation coefficient, r

PERCENTILE.d: Returns the k-th percentile of values in a range

PERCENTILE.EXC.d: Returns the k-th percentile of values in a range, where k is in the range 0..1, exclusive

PERCENTILE.INC.d: Returns the k-th percentile of values in a range, where k is in the range 0..1, inclusive

PERCENTRANK.d: Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set

PERCENTRANK.EXC.d: Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set as a percentage (0..1, exclusive) of the data set

PERCENTRANK.INC.d: Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set as a percentage (0..1, inclusive) of the data set

PERMUT.d: Returns the number of permutations for a given number of objects that can be selected from the total objects

PERMUTATIONA.d: Returns the number of permutations for a given number of objects (with repetitions) that can be selected from the total objects

PHI.d: Returns the value of the density function for a standard normal distribution

PROB.d: Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits or equal to a lower limit

QUARTILE.d: Returns the quartile of a data set

QUARTILE.INC.d: Returns the quartile of a data set, based on percentile values from 0..1, inclusive

QUARTILE.EXC.d: Returns the quartile of a data set, based on percentile values from 0..1, exclusive

RANK.d: Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers: its size relative to other values in the list

RANK.AVG.d: Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers: its size relative to other values in the list; if more than one value has the same rank, the average rank is returned

RANK.EQ.d: Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers: its size relative to other values in the list; if more than one value has the same rank, the top rank of that set of values is returned

RSQ.d: Returns the square of the Pearson product moment correlation coefficient through the given data points

SKEW.d: Returns the skewness of a distribution: a characterisation of the degree of asymmetry of a distribution around its mean

SKEW.P.d: Returns the skewness of a distribution based on a population: a characterisation of the degree of asymmetry of a distribution around its mean

SLOPE.d: Returns the slope of the linear regression line through the given data points

SMALL.d: Returns the k-th smallest value in a data set. For example, the fifth smallest number

STANDARDIZE.d: Returns a normalised value from a distribution characterised by a mean and standard deviation

STDEV.d: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample (ignores logical values and text in the sample)

STDEV.P.d: Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments (ignores logical values and text)

STDEV.S.d: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample (ignores logical values and text in the sample)

STDEVA.d: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample, including logical values and text. Text and the logical value FALSE have the value 0; the logical value TRUE has the value 1

STDEVP.d: Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments (ignores logical values and text)

STDEVPA.d: Calculates standard deviation based on an entire population, including logical values and text. Text and the logical value FALSE have the value 0; the logical value TRUE has the value 1

STEYX.d: Returns the standard error of the predicted y-value for each x in a regression

TINV.d: Returns the two-tailed inverse of the Student's t-distribution

T.INV.d: Returns the left-tailed inverse of the Student's t-distribution

T.INV.2T.d: Returns the two-tailed inverse of the Student's t-distribution

T.TEST.d: Returns the probability associated with a Student's t-Test

TREND.d: Returns numbers in a linear trend matching known data points, using the least squares method

TRIMMEAN.d: Returns the mean of the interior portion of a set of data values

TTEST.d: Returns the probability associated with a Student's t-Test

VAR.d: Estimates variance based on a sample (ignores logical values and text in the sample)

VAR.P.d: Calculates variance based on the entire population (ignores logical values and text in the population)

VAR.S.d: Estimates variance based on a sample (ignores logical values and text in the sample)

VARA.d: Estimates variance based on a sample, including logical values and text. Text and the logical value FALSE have the value 0; the logical value TRUE has the value 1

VARP.d: Calculates variance based on the entire population (ignores logical values and text in the population)

VARPA.d: Calculates variance based on the entire population, including logical values and text. Text and the logical value FALSE have the value 0; the logical value TRUE has the value 1

Z.TEST.d: Returns the one-tailed P-value of a z-test

ZTEST.d: Returns the one-tailed P-value of a z-test

ACCRINT.d: Returns the accrued interest for a security that pays periodic interest.

ACCRINTM.d: Returns the accrued interest for a security that pays interest at maturity

AMORDEGRC.d: Returns the prorated linear depreciation of an asset for each accounting period.

AMORLINC.d: Returns the prorated linear depreciation of an asset for each accounting period.

COUPDAYBS.d: Returns the number of days from the beginning of the coupon period to the settlement date

COUPDAYS.d: Returns the number of days in the coupon period that contains the settlement date

COUPDAYSNC.d: Returns the number of days from the settlement date to the next coupon date

COUPNCD.d: Returns the next coupon date after the settlement date

COUPNUM.d: Returns the number of coupons payable between the settlement date and maturity date

COUPPCD.d: Returns the previous coupon date before the settlement date

CUMIPMT.d: Returns the cumulative interest paid between two periods

CUMPRINC.d: Returns the cumulative principal paid on a loan between two periods

DB.d: Returns the depreciation of an asset for a specified period using the fixed-declining balance method

DDB.d: Returns the depreciation of an asset for a specified period using the double-declining balance method or some other method you specify

DISC.d: Returns the discount rate for a security

DOLLARDE.d: Converts a dollar price, expressed as a fraction, into a dollar price, expressed as a decimal number

DOLLARFR.d: Converts a dollar price, expressed as a decimal number, into a dollar price, expressed as a fraction

DURATION.d: Returns the annual duration of a security with periodic interest payments

EFFECT.d: Returns the effective annual interest rate

FV.d: Returns the future value of an investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate

FVSCHEDULE.d: Returns the future value of an initial principal after applying a series of compound interest rates

INTRATE.d: Returns the interest rate for a fully invested security

IPMT.d: Returns the interest payment for a given period for an investment, based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate

IRR.d: Returns the internal rate of return for a series of cash flows

ISPMT.d: Returns the interest paid during a specific period of an investment

MDURATION.d: Returns the Macauley modified duration for a security with an assumed par value of $100

MIRR.d: Returns the internal rate of return for a series of periodic cash flows, considering both cost of investment and interest on reinvestment of cash

NOMINAL.d: Returns the annual nominal interest rate

NPER.d: Returns the number of periods for an investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate

NPV.d: Returns the net present value of an investment based on a discount rate and a series of future payments (negative values) and income (positive values)

ODDFPRICE.a: (settlement; maturity; issue; first_coupon; rate; yld; redemption; frequency; [basis])
ODDFPRICE.d: Returns the price per $100 face value of a security with an odd first period

ODDFYIELD.a: (settlement; maturity; issue; first_coupon; rate; pr; redemption; frequency; [basis])
ODDFYIELD.d: Returns the yield of a security with an odd first period

ODDLPRICE.a: (settlement; maturity; last_interest; rate; yld; redemption; frequency; [basis])
ODDLPRICE.d: Returns the price per $100 face value of a security with an odd last period

ODDLYIELD.a: (settlement; maturity; last_interest; rate; pr; redemption; frequency; [basis])
ODDLYIELD.d: Returns the yield of a security with an odd last period

PDURATION.d: Returns the number of periods required by an investment to reach a specified value

PMT.d: Calculates the payment for a loan based on constant payments and a constant interest rate

PPMT.d: Returns the payment on the principal for a given investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate

PRICE.d: Returns the price per $100 face value of a security that pays periodic interest

PRICEDISC.d: Returns the price per $100 face value of a discounted security

PRICEMAT.d: Returns the price per $100 face value of a security that pays interest at maturity

PV.d: Returns the present value of an investment: the total amount that a series of future payments is worth now

RATE.d: Returns the interest rate per period of a loan or an investment. For example, use 6%/4 for quarterly payments at 6% APR

RECEIVED.d: Returns the amount received at maturity for a fully invested security

RRI.d: Returns an equivalent interest rate for the growth of an investment

SLN.d: Returns the straight-line depreciation of an asset for one period

SYD.d: Returns the sum-of-years' digits depreciation of an asset for a specified period

TBILLEQ.d: Returns the bond-equivalent yield for a treasury bill

TBILLPRICE.d: Returns the price per $100 face value for a treasury bill

TBILLYIELD.d: Returns the yield for a treasury bill

VDB.d: Returns the depreciation of an asset for any period you specify, including partial periods, using the double-declining balance method or some other method you specify

XIRR.d: Returns the internal rate of return for a schedule of cash flows

XNPV.d: Returns the net present value for a schedule of cash flows

YIELD.d: Returns the yield on a security that pays periodic interest

YIELDDISC.d: Returns the annual yield for a discounted security. For example, a treasury bill

YIELDMAT.d: Returns the annual yield of a security that pays interest at maturity

ABS.d: Returns the absolute value of a number, a number without its sign

ACOS.d: Returns the arccosine of a number, in radians in the range 0 to Pi. The arccosine is the angle whose cosine is Number

ACOSH.d: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine of a number

ACOT.d: Returns the arccotangent of a number, in radians in the range 0 to Pi.

ACOTH.d: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cotangent of a number

AGGREGATE.d: Returns an aggregate in a list or database

ARABIC.d: Converts a Roman numeral to Arabic

ASC.d: For Double-byte character set (DBCS) languages, the function changes full-width (double-byte) characters to half-width (single-byte) characters

ASIN.d: Returns the arcsine of a number in radians, in the range -Pi/2 to Pi/2

ASINH.d: Returns the inverse hyperbolic sine of a number

ATAN.d: Returns the arctangent of a number in radians, in the range -Pi/2 to Pi/2

ATAN2.d: Returns the arctangent of the specified x and y coordinates, in radians between -Pi and Pi, excluding -Pi

ATANH.d: Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent of a number

BASE.d: Converts a number into a text representation with the given radix (base)

CEILING.d: Rounds a number up, to the nearest multiple of significance

CEILING.MATH.d: Rounds a number up, to the nearest integer or to the nearest multiple of significance

CEILING.PRECISE.d: Returns a number that is rounded up to the nearest integer or to the nearest multiple of significance

COMBIN.d: Returns the number of combinations for a given number of items

COMBINA.d: Returns the number of combinations with repetitions for a given number of items

COS.d: Returns the cosine of an angle

COSH.d: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a number

COT.d: Returns the cotangent of an angle

COTH.d: Returns the hyperbolic cotangent of a number

CSC.d: Returns the cosecant of an angle

CSCH.d: Returns the hyperbolic cosecant of an angle

DECIMAL.d: Converts a text representation of a number in a given base into a decimal number

ECMA.CEILING.d: Rounds the number up to the nearest multiple of significance

EVEN.d: Rounds a positive number up and negative number down to the nearest even integer

EXP.d: Returns e raised to the power of a given number

FACT.d: Returns the factorial of a number, equal to 1*2*3*...* Number

FACTDOUBLE.d: Returns the double factorial of a number

FLOOR.d: Rounds a number down to the nearest multiple of significance

FLOOR.PRECISE.d: Returns a number that is rounded down to the nearest integer or to the nearest multiple of significance

FLOOR.MATH.d: Rounds a number down, to the nearest integer or to the nearest multiple of significance

INT.d: Rounds a number down to the nearest integer

ISO.CEILING.d: Returns a number that is rounded up to the nearest integer or to the nearest multiple of significance regardless of the sign of the number. However, if the number or the significance is zero, zero is returned.

LN.d: Returns the natural logarithm of a number

LOG.d: Returns the logarithm of a number to the base you specify

LOG10.d: Returns the base-10 logarithm of a number

MDETERM.d: Returns the matrix determinant of an array

MINVERSE.d: Returns the inverse matrix for the matrix stored in an array

MMULT.d: Returns the matrix product of two arrays, an array with the same number of rows as array1 and columns as array2

MOD.d: Returns the remainder after a number is divided by a divisor

MROUND.d: Returns a number rounded to the desired multiple

MULTINOMIAL.d: Returns the multinomial of a set of numbers

MUNIT.d: Returns the unit matrix for the specified dimension

ODD.d: Rounds a positive number up and negative number down to the nearest odd integer

PI.d: Returns the value of Pi, 3.14159265358979, accurate to 15 digits

POWER.d: Returns the result of a number raised to a power

PRODUCT.d: Multiplies all the numbers given as arguments

QUOTIENT.d: Returns the integer portion of a division

RAND.d: Returns a random number greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1, evenly distributed (changes on recalculation)

RANDARRAY.d: Returns an array of random numbers

RANDBETWEEN.d: Returns a random number between the numbers you specify

ROMAN.d: Converts an Arabic numeral to Roman, as text

ROUND.d: Rounds a number to a specified number of digits

ROUNDDOWN.d: Rounds a number down, towards zero

ROUNDUP.d: Rounds a number up, away from zero

SEC.d: Returns the secant of an angle

SECH.d: Returns the hyperbolic secant of an angle

SERIESSUM.d: Returns the sum of a power series based on the formula

SIGN.d: Returns the sign of a number: 1 if the number is positive, zero if the number is zero, or -1 if the number is negative

SIN.d: Returns the sine of an angle

SINH.d: Returns the hyperbolic sine of a number

SQRT.d: Returns the square root of a number

SQRTPI.d: Returns the square root of (number * Pi)

SUBTOTAL.d: Returns a subtotal in a list or database

SUM.d: Adds all the numbers in a range of cells

SUMIF.d: Adds the cells specified by a given condition or criteria

SUMIFS.d: Adds the cells specified by a given set of conditions or criteria

SUMPRODUCT.d: Returns the sum of the products of corresponding ranges or arrays

SUMSQ.d: Returns the sum of the squares of the arguments. The arguments can be numbers, arrays, names or references to cells that contain numbers

SUMX2MY2.d: Sums the differences between the squares of two corresponding ranges or arrays

SUMX2PY2.d: Returns the sum total of the sums of squares of numbers in two corresponding ranges or arrays

SUMXMY2.d: Sums the squares of the differences in two corresponding ranges or arrays

TAN.d: Returns the tangent of an angle

TANH.d: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of a number

TRUNC.d: Truncates a number to an integer by removing the decimal, or fractional, part of the number

ADDRESS.d: Creates a cell reference as text, given specified row and column numbers

CHOOSE.d: Chooses a value or action to perform from a list of values, based on an index number

COLUMN.d: Returns the column number of a reference

COLUMNS.d: Returns the number of columns in an array or reference

FORMULATEXT.d: Returns a formula as a string

HLOOKUP.d: Looks for a value in the top row of a table or array of values and returns the value in the same column from a row you specify

HYPERLINK.d: Creates a shortcut or jump that opens a document stored on your hard drive, a network server, or on the Internet

INDEX.d: Returns a value or reference of the cell at the intersection of a particular row and column, in a given range

INDIRECT.d: Returns the reference specified by a text string

LOOKUP.d: Looks up a value either from a one-row or one-column range or from an array. Provided for backwards compatibility

MATCH.d: Returns the relative position of an item in an array that matches a specified value in a specified order

OFFSET.d: Returns a reference to a range that is a given number of rows and columns from a given reference

ROW.d: Returns the row number of a reference

ROWS.d: Returns the number of rows in a reference or array

TRANSPOSE.d: Converts a vertical range of cells to a horizontal range, or vice versa

UNIQUE.d: Returns the unique values from a range or array.

VLOOKUP.d: Looks for a value in the leftmost column of a table and then returns a value in the same row from a column that you specify. By default, the table must be sorted in an ascending order

XLOOKUP.d: Searches a range or an array for a match and returns the corresponding item from a second range or array. By default, an exact match is used

CELL.d: Returns information about the formatting, location, or contents of a cell

ERROR.TYPE.d: Returns a number matching an error value.

ISBLANK.d: Checks whether a reference is to an empty cell, and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISERR.d: Checks whether a value is an error other than #N/A, and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISERROR.d: Checks whether a value is an error, and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISEVEN.d: Returns TRUE if the number is even

ISFORMULA.d: Checks whether a reference is to a cell containing a formula, and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISLOGICAL.d: Checks whether a value is a logical value (TRUE or FALSE), and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISNA.d: Checks whether a value is #N/A, and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISNONTEXT.d: Checks whether a value is not text (blank cells are not text), and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISNUMBER.d: Checks whether a value is a number, and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISODD.d: Returns TRUE if the number is odd

ISREF.d: Checks whether a value is a reference, and returns TRUE or FALSE

ISTEXT.d: Checks whether a value is text, and returns TRUE or FALSE

N.d: Converts non-number value to a number, dates to serial numbers, TRUE to 1, anything else to 0 (zero)

NA.d: Returns the error value #N/A (value not available)

SHEET.d: Returns the sheet number of the referenced sheet

SHEETS.d: Returns the number of sheets in a reference

TYPE.d: Returns an integer representing the data type of a value: number = 1; text = 2; logical value = 4; error value = 16; array = 64; compound data = 128

AND.d: Checks whether all arguments are TRUE, and returns TRUE if all arguments are TRUE

IF.d: Checks whether a condition is met, and returns one value if TRUE, and another value if FALSE

IFS.d: Checks whether one or more conditions are met and returns a value corresponding to the first TRUE condition

IFERROR.d: Returns value_if_error if expression is an error and the value of the expression itself otherwise

IFNA.d: Returns the value you specify if the expression resolves to #N/A, otherwise returns the result of the expression

NOT.d: Changes FALSE to TRUE, or TRUE to FALSE

OR.d: Checks whether any of the arguments are TRUE, and returns TRUE or FALSE. Returns FALSE only if all arguments are FALSE

SWITCH.d: Evaluates an expression against a list of values and returns the result corresponding to the first matching value. If there is no match, an optional default value is returned

XOR.d: Returns a logical 'Exclusive Or' of all arguments

TEXTBEFORE.d: Returns text thats before delimiting characters.

TEXTAFTER.d: Returns text thats after delimiting characters.

TEXTSPLIT.d: Splits text into rows or columns using delimiters.

WRAPROWS.d: Wraps a row or column vector after a specified number of values.

VSTACK.d: Vertically stacks arrays into one array.

HSTACK.d: Horizontally stacks arrays into one array.

CHOOSEROWS.d: Returns rows from an array or reference.

CHOOSECOLS.d: Returns columns from an array or reference.

TOCOL.d: Returns the array as one column.

TOROW.d: Returns the array as one row.

WRAPCOLS.d: Wraps a row or column vector after a specified number of values.

TAKE.d: Returns rows or columns from array start or end.

DROP.d: Drops rows or columns from array start or end.
